Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Private Litigation Case Title: Williams v. Supershuttle International, Inc. et al
Kairy et al v. Supershuttle International, Inc., et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/283196/9th-circ-revives-shuttle-driver-flsa-action

Private Litigation Case Title: Reid et al v. Supershuttle International, Inc. et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/308000/supershuttle-resolves-flsa-fight-with-ny-drivers
Notes: The amounts covers $394,500 in attorneys' fees and $34,500 in payments to class representatives. Other plaintiffs, who had been treated as independent contractors,  benefitted from the settlement mainly through provisions that provided assistance in selling their contracts to third parties.

Description: SuperShuttle Los Angeles agreed to pay $24,000 in attorneys fees and $1,500 in disgorgement to each of an estimated 165 franchisees in settlement of allegations it misrepresented material facts about the financial performance of its franchise offers.
